title: Account Executive
description:
Client Success Executive

*Full-time | Remote | Singapore-market focused*

**About KPI Media**

KPI Media is the fastest growing media agency in Singapore for a good reason. We’re the boutique agency that growth-obsessed brands go to when they’re tired of working with network agencies.

We turn 6 this year and have grown to become a S$2M ARR business with over 35 remote employees spread across 6 countries.

We work with scaleups & enterprise brands, like My First Skool, Helpling, Meltwater, KodeKloud, Circular, Kaspersky, Eco Ring, and so much more.

**What you need to know about this role**

This role supports the Client Success Manager in owning client outcomes, managing day-to-day client relationships, and assisting in ensuring the smooth running of media campaigns. The Client Success Executive will work alongside the Client Success Manager, performance teams, and analysts to deliver the best results for clients.

You’ll assist in managing client portfolios, protect the performance team, and support in executing growth-led strategies.

**What you will actually do**

As a Client Success Executive, you will be an integral part of a high-performing team, supporting the Client Success Manager in managing client relationships and ensuring that client expectations are met.

Client Support

* Assist in maintaining strong client relationships by providing timely communication and proactive support
* Help translate performance data into clear and actionable insights for clients
* Support the Client Success Manager in leading client meetings and ensuring client satisfaction
* Communicate clearly and effectively, ensuring that all client requests are addressed promptly
* Handle administrative tasks like client reporting, campaign tracking, and meeting notes

Media & Performance Assistance

* Help with preparing media plans, performance reports, and forecasting
* Understand key performance metrics (CPL, CPA, CAC, ROAS, CVR, etc.) and assist in evaluating campaign performance
* Spot potential performance risks and escalate them to the Client Success Manager in a timely manner
* Assist in ensuring media performance meets client expectations, while working closely with the Performance team

Internal Team Support

* Collaborate with the Client Success Manager to ensure smooth coordination within the team and across departments (Performance, Creative, Analytics)
* Assist in tracking project timelines and deliverables to ensure quality control and avoid burnout
* Learn and grow in client success methodologies, with the goal of becoming more independent in handling client portfolios

**What we are NOT looking for:**

* Someone who is solely focused on administration with no drive to learn about the client’s business
* Someone who only understands “best practices” but not trade-offs
* Someone who avoids taking responsibility or does not support senior team members
* Someone who needs constant validation before taking initiative

**Hard Requirements (non-negotiable)**

* Native or near-native English speaker (written and spoken)
* Strong understanding of the Singapore market, its clients, and decision-making culture
* 1-3 years of experience in client success / account management within a performance marketing agency or related field
* Basic understanding of digital media channels like Search, Social, LinkedIn, Meta, TikTok, etc.
* Proficiency with Excel / Sheets and familiarity with data analysis
* Strong communication skills, both written and verbal
* A proactive attitude with the ability to handle multiple tasks and clients effectively

**Nice to have (but not required)**

* Experience with paid media in an agency environment
* Familiarity with media buying or running campaigns hands-on
* Experience working with international teams or exposure to global markets
* Exposure to analytics tools beyond ad platforms (GA4, CRM data, etc.)

**What we offer:**

* Competitive salary packages
* 100% remote position – work from anywhere
* Company retreats every year for team-building
* Flexible working hours – work when it suits you
* Health and well-being benefits, including telemedicine services
* A diverse and international team with opportunities for growth
* Supportive leadership that values your contributions and encourages career development
* Annual salary increments and performance bonuses

Job Type: Full-time

title: Senior Digital Commerce Manager
description:
**Job Location**

Tanah Abang Dki Jakarta R

**Job Description**

As the **Senior Digital Commerce Manager,** you will identify and capitalize on business opportunities while collaborating with a multi-functional team to develop cohesive commercial plans. Your role will focus on identifying the right quantity and quality of content needed for brands to deliver their awareness , equity and GMV goals. You will work closely with regional brand teams to understand the brand equities, best practices in other regions and develop content in partnership with local KOLs and affiliates. You will also work closely with the ecommerce delivery team to develop the right quantity of content needed for us to deliver the GMV goals and lead local agencies to help deliver the content in line with the requirements. These eCommerce, and digital marketing strategies will enhance brand visibility and drive sales. You'll be expected to work closely with various subject matter experts to deliver comprehensive strategies that address consumer needs and shopping behaviors.

**Your Team**

You will report directly to the Brand Director for the Category or Business Unit. Collaboration will be key, as you will work extensively with colleagues from Consumer Market Knowledge, Sales, Communications, Finance, and Digital Marketing teams.

**What Success Looks Like**

1. **Achieve Business Targets aligned with the Business Unit's goals.**

* Drive our Scorecard, aiming for a 10× Social Commerce revenue growth over the next three years with clear annual milestones (e.g., Year 1: 3×; Year 2: 5-7×; Year 3: 10×).
* Meeting Scorecard Metrics: Ensure we meet key metrics, including awareness, equity and penetration rates to foster sustainable growth.
* Optimizing Channel Economics: Cultivate a positive and scalable P&L with guidelines on spending, take rates, and promotional ROI.

**Responsibilities of the Role**

* Digital Media Full Funnel Strategy – focusing on content quantity and quality to achieve awareness, equity and GMV goals. The content should focus on growing core brand awareness/equities amongst target consumers and also deliver monthly/quarterly GMV goals. The content should be delivered for base brands and on-top initiatives in partnership with regional teams and local agencies based on deep consumer and channel understanding.
* Social Commerce Strategy: Own the Integrated Social Commerce Plan, developing and executing strategies that align with key projects and initiatives to drive brand growth and profitability. Manage P&L investment decisions to optimize returns.
* Digital Transformation: Develop and implement an integrated digital action plan focusing on social media engagement, eCRM, digital advertising (including personalization and retargeting), search, and eCommerce initiatives.
* Consumer Insights: Identify and analyze consumers’ needs and preferences for P&G’s products, providing actionable insights to the Research & Development and technical teams to design appealing packages and formulas that resonate with local consumers.
* Creative Collaboration: Work with creative agencies to develop culturally relevant communication ideas and execute tailored content for various social media platforms.
* Toolkit Development: Create fit-for-purpose toolkits that include copy, digital banners, social media content, eCommerce materials, sampling trials, and in-store activation strategies.

**Job Qualifications**

* Bachelor or Master's Degree in a business-related field.
* 4-6 years of experience managing or growing TikTok with background in brand management, digital media, consulting or consumer journey design, preferably in FMCG, beauty or home care
* Comprehensive understanding of TikTok’s algorithm, SEO, paid advertising, and commerce integrations. Proven experience in managing creators, budgets, and paid collaborations effectively.
* Comprehensive understanding of the agency ecosystem and online/AI tools to develop content at scale with minimum over-head resources
* Demonstrated success in designing and executing strategies that deliver substantial business impact beyond just managing a single channel.
* Strong strategic thinking and problem-solving abilities, with a track record of driving innovation and brand growth.
* Excellent leadership skills, with the ability to communicate effectively and work collaboratively within a team environment.
* A forward-thinking approach with a passion for utilizing social media and digital marketing to strengthen brand presence and enhance consumer engagement.
* Comfortable with rapid experimentation, embracing new ideas and strategies to drive results.

**Join us in shaping the future of social commerce and driving the success of our iconic brands!**

**About us**
------------

We produce globally recognized brands and we grow the best business leaders in the industry. With a portfolio of trusted brands as diverse as ours, it is paramount our leaders are able to lead with courage the vast array of brands, categories and functions. We serve consumers around the world with one of the strongest portfolios of trusted, quality, leadership brands, including Always®, Ariel®, Gillette®, Head & Shoulders®, Herbal Essences®, Oral-B®, Pampers®, Pantene®, Tampax® and more. Our community includes operations in approximately 70 countries worldwide.

Visit http://www.pg.com to know more.

Our consumers are diverse and our talents - internally - mirror this diversity to best serve it. That is why we’re committed to building a winning culture based on Inclusion and our ideal candidate is passionate about the same principle: you will join our daily effort of being “in touch” so we craft brands and products to improve the lives of the world’s consumers now and in the future. We want you to inspire us with your unrivaled ideas.

We are committed to providing equal opportunities in employment. We do not discriminate against individuals on the basis of race, color, gender, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, citizenship, disability, veteran status, HIV/AIDS status, or any other legally protected factor.

**Job Schedule**

Full time

**Job Number**

R000144801

**Job Segmentation**

Experienced Professionals
company_description: Also known as P&G, Proctor & Gamble is a U.S.-based consumer goods company that produces and distributes a variety of personal care and cleaning products around the world.

title: IT Director
description:
**Company overview**

CapsLock is a global IT marketing company that pioneers unique, scalable customer acquisition solutions for B2C clients. We solve complex sales challenges across a wide range of industries, primarily for large North American partners. By integrating our expertise in Digital Marketing, IT, Design, AI-driven analytics, proprietary MarTech, and sales consulting we deliver powerful, data-informed customer acquisition solutions.

At CapsLock, people, technology, and forward-thinking innovation lie at the heart of everything we do. Our core values guide our approach to building and refining an internal product ecosystem that powers profitable acquisition models, flexible scaling, and optimized operations. Our diverse, global team, fluent in over 10 languages, thrives on open collaboration and the exchange of new ideas, pushing boundaries to ensure our clients’ success.

**Role overview**

The IT Director will report directly to the Chief Technology Officer (CTO) and will be a key leader responsible for building a scalable, reliable, and secure technology foundation for CapsLock's internal products: MarTech platform, AI Agents, Automation tools.

You will directly lead senior technical leaders and functions: Head of Engineering, Head of QA, Security Manager, and the AI Team. In close partnership with the Product Director, you will turn strategy into predictable delivery, modernize our engineering and quality practices, and ensure our platforms are ready to scale with performance marketing demands.

This role is for a hands-on technology leader who can operate at two levels: (1) collaboration with cross-functional teams and clear reporting to executive-level, and (2) deep collaboration with internal engineering team and domain teams to solve complex systems, data, and automation challenges.

**Responsibilities**

*Management and collaboration*

* Lead and develop the technology organization through senior leaders
* Build a high-performance engineering culture based on innovation, continuous improvement, technical excellence, accountability and AI-driven mindset
* Partner tightly with the Product Director to align product vision, technical strategy, capacity planning, and quarterly delivery commitments.
* Collaborate with executive leadership on strategy, prioritization, and investment decisions (people, tooling, infrastructure)
* Create a transparent reporting rhythm for stakeholders

*Technology* *Strategy and processes*

* Define and drive a multi-year technology strategy
* Establish an engineering operating system: planning cadence, execution rituals, delivery metrics, decision logs, and cross-team coordination that scales
* Own the technical roadmap alongside Product
* Make pragmatic build-vs-buy decisions; evaluate vendors and technologies with a clear ROI and long-term maintainability lens.
* Implement agile methodologies
* Ensure security, compliance, and risk management across all IT systems

*Execution and delivery leadership*

* Ensure predictable, high-quality delivery across Engineering and AI/R&D
* Set standards for product specifications handoff, technical design reviews, estimation, and quality gates
* Improve engineering throughput and quality using measurable indicators and targeted improvements
* Champion pragmatic documentation

*Quality assurance and reliability*

* Lead QA strategy through the Head of QA
* Implement reliability practices
* Own release governance and staged rollouts

*AI and R&D leadership*

* Guide the AI Team to deliver production-grade AI capabilities, moving from prototypes to reliable systems
* Partner with Product to identify high-leverage AI opportunities and deliver measurable impact
* Set responsible AI practices: data privacy, model governance, human-in-the-loop controls where appropriate, and ongoing quality monitoring

*Talent, hiring, and team development*

* Shape org design and hiring plans to support growth
* Coach and mentor leaders; establish career ladders and performance expectations that retain top talent
* Create a learning culture

  
Requirements:
  

* 8+ years of experience in software engineering, including 4+ years in senior leadership roles (Director/Head/Engineering Manager leading managers)
* Proven experience leading multiple teams and senior leaders across Engineering, QA, and Security (directly or via strong managers)
* Strong background in building and scaling high-availability systems, automation platforms, and data-heavy products with clear performance requirements
* Hands-on understanding of modern software architecture (services, APIs, event-driven systems) and pragmatic technical decision-making
* Strong DevOps and cloud fundamentals: CI/CD, Infrastructure as Code, containerization, server-less technologies, observability, and operational excellence
* Track record of improving delivery predictability and quality through process, metrics, and technical leadership - not bureaucracy
* Strong security mindset: experience implementing secure practices and partnering with security/compliance functions
* Experience in collaborating with remote teams across different cultures and time zones
* Experience with agile methodologies and modern software development practices

**Essential Qualities**

* People-first leader who raises standards while building trust, clarity, and a sustainable pace
* Systems thinker who can connect product outcomes, engineering constraints, and operational realities into one plan
* Calm, decisive, and accountable under pressure (incidents, tight deadlines, high-stakes automation)
* High ownership and high degree of autonomy: you build structure where needed, remove friction, and make trade-offs explicit
* Strong collaborator: you are at your best when Engineering and Product are aligned and moving as one team
* Ability to communicate clearly with executives and non-technical stakeholders, and to report progress and risk with crisp narratives
* Strategic thinker with ability to balance short-term needs and long-term objectives
* Comfortable working in fast-moving environments where business impact, uptime, and correctness matter

**Nice to have**

* Experience with performance marketing ecosystems (Meta, Google, TikTok) and the realities of CPA/ROAS optimization, pacing, and attribution
* Experience with AI/ML technologies and implementing AI-driven solutions
* Knowledge of marketing technology platforms and digital marketing ecosystem
* Experience with cloud infrastructure and microservices architecture
* Experience with data platforms (lake/warehouse, ELT pipelines, event tracking, data contracts) and analytics governance
* Familiarity with common stacks used for high-scale web services and data products (e.g., PHP, Node.js, Go; PostgreSQL or similar)
* Professional degree in Computer Science, IT, or related field: bachelor degree, master degree, MBA, etc

**Why do we deserve your attention?**

* **Remote Work -** we are a truly remote-first company. You choose where you feel the most productive and comfortable to make an impact.
* **Paid Time Off -** work-life balance matters to us, and we support it with paid time off for rest, personal time, or simply doing what makes you happy.
* **Unlimited Sick Days -** your health matters. Take the time you need to rest and recover - we’ll be here when you’re ready to return.
* **Ongoing Learning -** we believe in curiosity and growth. That’s why we support continuous learning with workshops, online courses, conferences, and certifications.
* **Home Office -** we help you set up your perfect workspace by covering equipment and furniture expenses, so you can do your best work from home.
* **Co-Working Space -** if you sometimes crave a change of scenery or more social interaction, we’ll cover the full cost of a co-working space.
* **Medical Coverage -** we support you and your family with reimbursement for medical insurance and health-related expenses, including dental care and psychological support.
* **Physical Well-Being -** from gym memberships and yoga classes to home workout equipment or even a bicycle, we give you the flexibility to stay active your way.

**Fun Stuff -** from gaming nights and fitness challenges to annual retreats at world-class resorts, we make sure there’s never a shortage of fun and connection.

title: Head of Product
description:
**Company overview**

CapsLock is a global IT marketing company that pioneers unique, scalable customer acquisition solutions for B2C clients. We solve complex sales challenges across a wide range of industries, primarily for large North American partners. By integrating our expertise in Digital Marketing, IT, Design, AI-driven analytics, proprietary MarTech, and sales consulting we deliver powerful, data-informed customer acquisition solutions.

At CapsLock, people, technology, and forward-thinking innovation lie at the heart of everything we do. Our core values guide our approach to building and refining an internal product ecosystem that powers profitable acquisition models, flexible scaling, and optimized operations. Our diverse, global team, fluent in over 10 languages, thrives on open collaboration and the exchange of new ideas, pushing boundaries to ensure our clients’ success.

**Role Overview**

The Head of Product is a new role in our company, which gives a great opportunity to build the whole department from scratch. You will report directly to the CTO and partner closely with the CEO and senior business leaders. You will own the product vision, strategy, and execution for CapsLock’s internal MarTech portfolio - Media Buyer Automation Platform, AI Call Centre, Experimentation & A/B Testing, and AI SMS - turning them into a durable competitive advantage. This role is equal parts builder and leader: you will strengthen product fundamentals while growing a high-performance Product Team that ships fast, learns faster, and drives measurable revenue and cost impact.

**Responsibilities**

**Leadership & cross-functional collaboration**

* Build, lead, and mentor a high-performing Product Team
* Partner daily with Engineering, Data, Media Buying, Creative, and Operations to translate acquisition realities into product direction and shipped outcomes.
* Create a strong culture of accountability and continuous improvement
* Represent Product at the executive level

**Product strategy & vision**

* Define and continuously refine product strategy, grounded in business priorities and a clear point of view on what “great” looks like
* Own product roadmaps end-to-end
* Translate strategy into quarterly OKRs and measurable goals, ensuring alignment across Product, Engineering, and performance teams
* Lead market and competitor research to pressure-test our direction and identify new opportunities

**Business ownership, data & experimentation**

* Own the performance outcomes of the product portfolio - tie product work to company impact and cost efficiency
* Build decision frameworks that combine product analytics, experimentation results, and operational feedback to guide prioritization
* Establish an experimentation system across the stack: A/B testing strategy, feature flagging, hypothesis templates, guardrails, and statistical hygiene

**Execution & delivery leadership**

* Lead end-to-end delivery across multiple workstreams: align scope, sequencing, and resourcing
* Partner with Engineering leaders to ensure delivery plans are observable
* Raise the bar on product quality: instrumentation, QA readiness, edge-case handling, launch checklists, and incident/rollback playbooks
* Own go-to-internal adoption: onboarding, enablement, documentation, and feedback loops
* Establish strong release governance: staged rollouts, monitoring, and post-launch reviews

  
Requirements:
  

* 7+ years of experience in Product Management, including senior leadership roles (Director / Head of / Group PM / Lead).
* Proven experience owning complex, data-heavy products end-to-end - from discovery and strategy through delivery, adoption, and scaling.
* Experience building and leading product teams: hiring, mentoring, setting standards, and creating a high-performance culture.
* Confident data and analytics fluency: experience with metrics design, instrumentation/event taxonomy, dashboards, and the ability to turn data into decisions.
* Excellent executive reporting skills: clear narratives, crisp trade-offs, and steady communication under ambiguity.
* Experience working effectively with distributed teams across time zones
* Strong written and verbal English communication.

**Essential** **Qualities**

* People-first leader who develops others, gives direct feedback, and raises the bar while building a sustainable, motivated team.
* Strong business & performance ownership mindset: comfortable with revenue/cost impact, ROI modeling, and prioritizing by measurable outcomes.
* Systems thinker with strong product judgment - able to balance short-term performance wins with long-term platform health and scalability.
* High degree of autonomy and ownership: comfortable navigating ambiguity, making decisions, and driving outcomes end-to-end.
* Exceptional communicator and relationship builder who aligns executives, engineers, and performance teams around one plan and one scorecard.
* Data-driven and intellectually honest: uses metrics and experiments to learn quickly, and adjusts direction based on evidence.

**Nice to have**

* Deep understanding of performance marketing and lead generation funnels; familiarity with paid acquisition platforms (Meta, Google, TikTok) and creative testing workflows.
* Experience with CPA / ROAS optimization, budget pacing, and attribution challenges (including event quality, signal loss, and measurement trade-offs).
* Hands-on experience building automation products for media buying operations (rules engines, pacing, alerts, spend controls, and workflow tooling).
* Experience with AI/LLM-powered products or voice technologies (e.g., call centre automation, conversation intelligence, QA, routing).

**Why do we deserve your attention?**

* **Remote Work -** we are a truly remote-first company. You choose where you feel the most productive and comfortable to make an impact.
* **Paid Time Off -** work-life balance matters to us, and we support it with paid time off for rest, personal time, or simply doing what makes you happy.
* **Unlimited Sick Days -** your health matters. Take the time you need to rest and recover - we’ll be here when you’re ready to return.
* **Ongoing Learning -** we believe in curiosity and growth. That’s why we support continuous learning with workshops, online courses, conferences, and certifications.
* **Home Office -** we help you set up your perfect workspace by covering equipment and furniture expenses, so you can do your best work from home.
* **Co-Working Space -** if you sometimes crave a change of scenery or more social interaction, we’ll cover the full cost of a co-working space.
* **Medical Coverage -** we support you and your family with reimbursement for medical insurance and health-related expenses, including dental care and psychological support.
* **Physical Well-Being -** from gym memberships and yoga classes to home workout equipment or even a bicycle, we give you the flexibility to stay active your way.
* **Fun Stuff -** from gaming nights and fitness challenges to annual retreats at world-class resorts, we make sure there’s never a shortage of fun and connection.

title: Email / SMS Copywriter (AI First)
description:
We're an innovative e-comm and healthcare brand building something big and straightforward: the best place for those over 45 to get real health care that helps them feel strong, healthy, and happy as they get older. Separately, we also buy and grow businesses that are leaders in their niches.  
  
WHO WE ARE & HOW WE OPERATE  
We're a hard-driving, fast-paced team of continuous improvers—a team, not a family—hiring and developing stars (leaders) in every role. We live by six core beliefs that drive massive success:

**Remarkable**: Go the extra mile to create jaw-dropping experiences (JDCE) that turn first-timers into re-order loyalists-we're in the reorder business. Develop unique superpowers; do what competitors won't.

**Adaptable**: Lifelong learners who grow or die-learn fast, fail fast, grab ideas anywhere, simplify everything, and proactively fix/improve everything around you.

**Accountable**: Own your outcomes like it's your company - be demanding yet supportive, 100% responsibility, share updates in Slack/Kustomer (our collective brain), own mistakes and fix them fast.

**Speed is King**: Act now over perfection; good executed today beats perfect next week. Maniacal urgency, get sh\\*t done measurably, predisposed to action and efficiency.

**Don't Sugar Coat It**: Tell the truth straight - tough talks help growth; - uncomfortable conversations fuel progress; no avoidance, speak up respectfully.

**Humble**: Think of the business first - admit gaps, share wins, own losses, pick what's right over who's right.

**Role:**
=========

We are looking for a sharp, creative, fast, AI-First Email/SMS Copy Manager to join the team. This is a role for someone who loves email, understands how to develop and iterate on a brand, understands how to write copy that HOLDS ATTENTION, and knows how to use AI as a co-pilot…

…not a crutch.

You’ll own copywriting for 1 brand responsible for creating high-converting, brand-aligned email campaigns and flows—averaging 30+ emails & 30+ sms, per month. From product (warm up sequences) to educational content, to lead nurture (working to convert qualified leads into sales) to flows that touch the entire customer journey, you'll create everything from scratch or refine AI-generated drafts with exceptional taste and judgment, to make sure that every email is both human and refined. Given our client-base, native-level English is a must for this role.

**Key Responsibilities:**
-------------------------

Optimize deliverability via klaviyo or sendlane or beehiv

Write, edit, and optimize email campaigns and automated flows (including welcome, nurture, retention, product launches, promos, etc.)

Manage copy calendars and deliverables across 2 brands

Use AI tools (ChatGPT, Claude, etc.) to brainstorm, outline, and draft faster—without compromising brand voice or quality

Work closely to align copy direction with client needs and performance insights—adjusting messaging based on trends in metrics like opens,clicks, and conversions

Collaborate with designers and project managers to bring each email to life with compelling copy and cohesive visual direction

Own voice adaptation for each brand, maintaining consistency and tone across messages

Create A/B variants for subject lines, headers, and call-to-actions—and synthesize learnings to improve future performance

Collaborate with strategists and designers to bring each email to life with compelling copy + visual cohesion

Maintain fast-paced, high-quality output within a repeatable, efficient process

**You’re Perfect If You:**

Have 3 to 5 years of copywriting experience, ideally in email, DTC, or digital performance marketing

Know how to write fast and well, particularly with AI

Are comfortable managing multiple brand voices

Know how to test creatively (and interpret results intelligently)

Can handle high-volume copy demands without sacrificing taste or clarity

**What you get:**
-----------------

Stable, predictable income (no chasing clients or lessons)

Remote freedom (webcam + fast internet required)

Growth track—top performers level up fast & can move to sales, marketing, ops, leadership

Be part of building something huge in longevity (helping customers live longer, healthier-meaningful AF

***Tools You Might Use:***

ChatGPT, Claude, Jasper.ai Copy.ai (or similar)

Klaviyo, Figma, Google Docs, Trello, Slack  
  
***What we expect from you:***

High work ethic (Monday-Saturday)

Be a team player committed to client wins.  
  
***Benefits***

The stuff below is cool as well.

* Remote: our team is fully distributed across the world and functions fully remotely.
* Personal development: budget for books, courses, coaching.
* Personal wellness: budget for gym, health apps.
* What are we missing? We're still early so you get to shape our culture.

**How to apply**
================

* Apply here on ashby
* Next Fill out the assessment at superhumanplan.com

title: Senior Affiliate Executive
description:
**Who we are**

Intrepid Asia is a leading Ecommerce and Digital Solutions Provider in South East Asia. We offer end-to-end omni-channel ecommerce management, Livestreaming, Video production & Affiliate Management for Social Commerce plus full funnel Digital Marketing Services and advanced Market Intelligence, all powered by state of the art inhouse Technology to our client base of leading international brands across all key marketplaces and social platforms in all 6 SEA countries. Brands love our regional presence, our excellent data-driven and growth-focused services which are enabled by the strongest team in the industry, and our advanced marketing and tech capabilities.

We are growing rapidly and as the exclusive partner of Flywheel in SEA, we offer many exciting opportunities to work with leading brands across multiple categories and key industry players. By joining us, you will work on the cutting edge of digital and social commerce in SEA, and experience what it takes to drive a successful ecommerce business end-to-end.

**The team you will be part of**

The Social Commerce Team is a fast-growing team leading the way in livestream selling, short video content, and affiliate marketing across Southeast Asia. We work with top brands, combining creativity, data, and platform expertise to drive real commercial results. As part of Intrepid’s end-to-end eCommerce ecosystem, we gain broad exposure across operations, collaborate with cross-functional experts, and play a key role in shaping how brands connect with digital shoppers in real time.

**The part you will play**

We are looking for a results-driven Affiliate Executive to manage and grow our affiliate marketing initiatives, with a strong focus on TikTok Shop campaigns. The ideal candidate has 2 years of proven experience in affiliate marketing, influencer management, or e-commerce, particularly in TikTok Shop live selling, campaigns, and performance optimization. You will be responsible for building relationships with affiliates, optimizing performance, and ensuring campaigns meet KPIs while aligning with the brand's marketing objectives.

**As an Affiliate Executive, you will take charge of**

* Manage day-to-day operations of the affiliate program, primarily on Shopee & TikTok Shop, from recruitment to campaign execution.
* Build a strategic plan on how to optimize and leverage affiliate business in Shopee & TikTok Shop.
* Creating a strategic plan on how to nurture until sustaining affiliate communities.
* Identify, onboard, and nurture relationships with affiliates, creators, and live streamers to promote brand products.
* Coordinate with content creators and external stakeholders to ensure brand messaging and visuals are aligned with campaign goals.
* Monitor affiliate performance, analyze data, and prepare regular reports to track ROI and sales growth.
* Negotiate commission structures and special incentives to maximize affiliate engagement.
* Collaborate with marketing, e-commerce, and creative teams to develop strategies that drive traffic and conversions.
* Stay updated on Shopee & TikTok Shop trends, algorithm changes, and competitive landscape to keep campaigns optimized.
* Assist in planning and executing promotional campaigns for e-commerce sales events (e.g., 8.8, 9.9, 11.11).
* Ensure all affiliate activities comply with brand guidelines and platform policies.
* Explore and test new affiliate platforms and marketing opportunities for expansion.

  

**What we are looking for - the ideal profile**

* Strong understanding of Shopee & TikTok Shop affiliate tools and campaign mechanics.
* Excellent communication and relationship management skills.
* Data-driven mindset with the ability to analyze metrics and make strategic decisions.
* Basic knowledge of online sales funnels, performance marketing, and social media engagement.
* Self-motivated and proactive with a problem-solving attitude.
* Able to work under pressure and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment.
* Creative thinker who can adapt to trends quickly.
* Experience managing multi-category products (e.g., fashion, beauty, FMCG).
* Knowledge of other affiliate platforms or influencer marketing tools.
* Background in live selling or campaign project management.
* Have an experience working in the affiliates industry is a plus

  

**In return, you will be getting**

* You will work with our portfolio of leading international brands, delivering engaging livestreams and video content to the highest standards. This role offers exposure and experience that can open many opportunities in the industry. Many of our livestream hosts have gone on to become key brand ambassadors or built followings of millions while at Intrepid — the world is truly your oyster!
* We believe in an end to end omni-channel and full funnel approach to ensure seamless and consistent consumer journeys, and intrepid is one of the very few players who offer that full array of services under one roof. Brands love this model as it's streamlined and delivers strong performance, hence we are rapidly growing. This offers you wide exposure and exciting growth opportunities
* We believe in the combined power of creative genius and a data-driven approach. Whether it is live streaming, video or affiliates, you will have the data and knowledge how to analyze & optimize at your fingertips, so you can add that spark of creative brilliance to create magic. With your talent and our training, we deliver high performance.
* We are international, we know how to scale, and we are stable. Content is local, but what resonates and best practices apply across countries. Our regional exposure and teams allow us to learn faster and organize ourselves in the best way possible. You are joining a proven international company with a strong track record, but we move fast with a lot of freedom, a collaborative culture and no politics. The best of both worlds.

  

**We also offer**

**Best of Both Worlds**

We are a scale up: the sophistication of a small multinational, with the agility of a start-up. This means you get to work on cutting-edge projects, and besides your 'standard' job description, we love to see you show entrepreneurial initiative and want to see your take on how you can take your role and our company to the next level. Good ideas get implemented. You are the master of your own destiny.

**Culture that Brings Out the Best**

At Intrepid, culture is not just a buzzword, it is what we practice at work every day. We believe in collaboration over competition, transparency over politics, and willingness to learn over ego. You will be part of a team where people genuinely support one another, celebrate wins together, and face challenges head-on as one. We put our all into the work but we balance it with fun, whether that is through team lunches, after-work hangouts, events or shared laughter in the office. This is a place where you can thrive professionally while having a great time.

**Grow Without Limits**

Learning at Intrepid is constant and dynamic. You will have access to formal training through face-to-face sessions, coaching and our very own Intrepid Academy. On top of that, real-world experience such as leading clients, working with advanced tech, and mastering best-in-class processes will accelerate your growth every step of the way. Surrounded by a talented team that raises the bar daily, in a rapidly growing and ever-expanding business, the opportunities for your development are endless.

**Rewarding You Right**

We believe great work deserves great rewards at Intrepid. That’s why we offer competitive compensation and generous benefits, including comprehensive insurance and ample leave, to support you both in and out of the workplace. We want you to feel valued, cared for, and empowered to bring your best self to work every day.

*Note: We will not be accepting any unsolicited resumes or CVs from headhunting or recruitment agencies at this point. Any CVs or profiles shared with us will not be entertained, and in the event of dispute, Intrepid will not be liable for any material compensation to third parties*

title: Senior Account Executive, Jakarta
description:
*You’re the kind of person who looks at the way technology is reshaping our world and thinks, “I want to be part of that.” Complex problems excite you. Being in the middle of fast-moving conversations, influencing outcomes, and helping clients navigate their next big challenge gives you energy.*

  

*You thrive when surrounded by sharp, curious teammates — people who push your thinking, value collaboration, and aren’t afraid to challenge the status quo. You’re fascinated by how emerging technologies like GenAI, FinTech innovation, blockchain applications, and Greentech breakthroughs can redefine industries and open entirely new possibilities. And you want to be right where those shifts are happening.*

  

*We’re looking for individuals who bring that same spark — high-energy, intelligent, ambitious talents who see themselves growing into trusted communication consultants and future leaders. People who bring fresh ideas, a sense of humor, and an open mind. People who enjoy working across teams, across markets, and across perspectives.*

  

*If this feels like a story you want to be part of, turn the page.*

  

**The Plot Thickens: Job Description — Senior Account Executive**

**What** **You’ll** **Do:**

* Act as a trusted business partner to clients — providing strategic communications counsel that aligns with business objectives and drives competitive differentiation.

* Develop and execute IMC strategies leveraging owned, earned, and paid media channels.

* Build and nurture strong relationships with journalists and editors, content creators, and analysts.

* Champion the agency’s reputation and culture by embodying leadership, creativity, and strategic excellence across markets.

* Support multiple client accounts and regional projects, ensuring profitability, quality of service, and award-worthy outcomes.

* Support senior team members in client engagement and project planning, contributing ideas to strengthen campaign outcomes.

* Build and maintain client relationships (including C-suite), assisting in communications with senior stakeholders where appropriate.

* Anticipate challenges, identify opportunities, and proactively shape strategies that advance both client and agency goals.

* Contribute to new business efforts by supporting pitch decks, and presentations with insights.

* Participate in developing and applying Hoffman Agency (HA) products and methodologies for regional replication.

* Contribute to agency growth initiatives such as off-sites, “lunch bucket” presentations, and cross-regional knowledge sharing.

  

**Attributes of the Protagonist (That’s You)**

  

* Strategic thinker who sees the bigger picture and can translate business goals into communication strategies that drive real impact.

* Build strong relationship with clients, media, and content creators, learning to engage professionally and contribute to trust -building efforts.

* Team player, known for developing talent, fostering creativity, and empowering teams to achieve their best.

* Storyteller and communicator with exceptional writing, presentation, and persuasion skills across both traditional and digital platforms.

* Digital-savvy strategist who integrates data-driven insights, social media, and emerging technologies into holistic campaigns.

* Problem solver who anticipates challenges, navigates ambiguity, and turns obstacles into strategic opportunities.

* Trailblazer with curiosity and courage to push boundaries, experiment with new ideas, and set benchmarks for excellence.

* Collaborative influencer within the agency network — sharing knowledge generously and inspiring regional peers.

* Commercially minded professional who balances creativity with profitability, ensuring sustainable client and agency growth.

* Culture shaper, bringing energy, integrity, and inclusiveness that strengthens the agency’s reputation both internally and externally.

  

**The Hero’s Background: Qualifications**

  

* Bachelor's degree in Communications, Public Relations, Marketing, or related field; postgraduate or MBA qualification is a plus

* 3–5 years of experience in public relations, integrated communications, or marketing — preferably within an agency environment

* Experience supporting regional or multi-market client accounts with measurable business impact

* Understanding of the technology, B2B, or digital ecosystem — able to connect insights across industries such as IoT, semiconductors, or supply chain

* Strong strategic planning skills with the ability to translate client business goals into compelling communication campaigns

* Demonstrated expertise in media relations, storytelling, and stakeholder engagement at senior and C-suite levels

* Hands-on experience managing cross-functional teams and mentoring mid-level leaders to success

* Solid grasp of digital and social media trends, analytics, and integration of owned, earned, and paid channels

* Excellent presentation, writing, and client consulting skills — persuasive, articulate, and confident under pressure

* Entrepreneurial mindset with commercial acumen; able to balance creative innovation with business profitability

* Comfortable operating in fast-paced, multicultural, and matrix environments across APAC or global markets

  

**About The Hoffman Agency**

We are an **integrated communications consultancy** built to solve tough challenges — the more complex, the better — for technology companies shaping the future. Headquartered in **Silicon Valley**, our network spans across global innovation hubs including **Bangkok, Boston, Beijing, Hong Kong, Jakarta, Kuala Lumpur, London, Munich, Paris, Portland, San Jose, Seoul, Shanghai, Singapore, Taipei, and Tokyo**.

  

At Hoffman, we combine deep tech understanding with bold storytelling to help brands stand out, influence conversations, and drive meaningful impact.

For more information, visit www.hoffman.com

  

We are proud to be a **diverse and inclusive workplace** — one that celebrates individuality and welcomes people of all backgrounds. We’re an **equal opportunity employer**, and we encourage applications from all individuals regardless of race, ethnicity, nationality, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, religion, disability, or veteran status.

  

Join us and be at the forefront of **marketing and communications innovation**, partnering with **industry-leading technology brands** across the world. We value **diverse perspectives**, **inclusive decision-making**, and ideas that **push boundaries** to shape what’s next.

  

We offer a **competitive salary**, **comprehensive benefits**, and **career growth opportunities** — plus a unique **four-week paid sabbatical after four years of service**, because we believe in rewarding dedication and balance.

title: System Engineer
description:
* Leading requirement gathering workshops with clients or internal users.
* Designing Salesforce solutions according to business needs.
  ⁠
* Performing configuration and customization in Salesforce.
* Creating functional and technical documentation.
  ⁠
* Providing training to users and conducting knowledge transfer.
* Collaborate with developers, administrators, and project managers.

  

* Minimum Qualifications: Minimum education Bachelor’s degree (S1) in Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field
* 5–7 years of work experience in CRM, with at least 3 years using Salesforce.
    
  + Experience in end-to-end Salesforce implementation (Sales Cloud, Service Cloud, Marketing Cloud, etc.).
* Solid understanding of Linux system administration, including:
* Mastery of Salesforce configuration, customization, and integration.
  ⁠
* Understanding of Apex, Visualforce, Lightning Components, SOQL, REST/SOAP API. Experience integrating Salesforce with external systems (ERP, HRIS, Data Warehouse).
  ⁠
* Ability to create data models, automation (Flow, Process Builder), and reports/dashboards.
  ⁠
* Familiarity with Agile/Scrum methodology
  ⁠
* Ability to perform requirement gathering, solution design, and deployment.

  

Our History
  
  
PT. MASTERSYSTEM INFOTAMA (MSI) was established in July 1994. Through the long journey, Mastersystem has developed into one of the leading ICT infrastructures providers and dominates not only the enterprise banking market in Indonesia, but also in oil and gas, enterprise and telecommunication industry.
  
  
Headquartered in Jakarta, MSI has branch office in Surabaya, East Java. MSI has more than 400 employees now with the majority are certified professionals.
  
  
As our commitment to deliver high quality standard of services, we comply with ISO standard i.e. ISO 9001:2015 (Quality Management) and ISO/IEC 20000-1:2011 (IT Service Management) to serve our customers better.
  
  
1994 Establishment as a PC distributor
  
1996- 1999 Beginning of network and system integration business, Clients: 20
  
2004 Cisco Gold Partner, Microsoft Large Account Reseller, HP First Tier Partner, Clients: 60,
  
2009 Beginning of data driven solution era, Clients: 140
  
2011 Virtual Desktop Infrastructure
  
2013 - 2014 Security Analytics and Contact Center, Clients: 250
  
2016 Big Data Analytics and API Gateway, Clients: 500
  
2018 - Now Next Gen Technologies (AI, IoT), Focus on Intellectual Property, Clients: 1000+
  
  
Why Mastersystem Infotama
  
  
Driven by technology powered business innovation and committed to bridge the gap between technology and business needs, we empowering business by building, integrating, and providing consultation the customers need.
  
  
Proven track record of success selling in a highly competitive environment, Mastersystem Infotama offers decades of experience to deliver quality solutions and help your organization to stay on top of the market trends and strengthening your value propositions to keep growing.  
  
  
  
Awards & Recognitions
  
  
Mastersystem Infotama - 2018 Infoblox Top ASEAN Partner of the Year
  
Mastersystem Infotama - 2018 Cisco Most Innovative Partner of the Year
  
Mastersystem Infotama - 2018 Cloudera Strategic Deal of the Year
  
Mastersystem Infotama - 2018 Redhat Ready Partner of the Year
  
Mastersystem Infotama - 2018 Cisco APJC Digital Innovation Award
  
Mastersystem Infotama - 2017 Cisco Partner of the Year
  
Mastersystem Infotama - 2017 Microsoft Country Partner of the Year
  
Mastersystem Infotama - 2017 Citrix ASEAN Special Recognition
  
Mastersystem Infotama - 2017 HP Fastest Growing Hybrid IT Corporate Reseller & PS  
  
  
  
Our Vision, Mission & Value
  
  
Vision
  
To be Indonesia leader in ICT industry.
  
  
Mission
  
Bring value to all the stakeholders.
  
Empowering business with innovative technologies, solutions and services.
  
  
Our Core Value
  
E excellence
  
T teamwork
  
H honesty
  
I innovation
  
C competence

title: Regional Bancassurance Head
description:
At AIA we’ve started an exciting movement to create a healthier, more sustainable future for everyone.

*It’s about finding new ways to not only better people's lives, but to better the communities and environments we live in. Encompassing our ambition of helping a billion people live Healthier, Longer, Better Lives by 2030.*

*And as part of our marketing, distribution & partnership team, you’ll play a vital part in advancing this movement. From inspiring meaningful connections with customers, partners and other stakeholders, to delivering purpose-led brand positioning and messaging, you'll be making a positive, healthy impact across all channels. You will have a unique and important part to play in helping more people live Healthier, Longer, Better Lives.*

So if you believe in inspiring a better future, read on.

About the Role

Ensure the business achievement in the Bancassurance distribution channel meet with company expectation.

Job Description

Achieve sales performance target that includes:

* Creating sales strategy & making a business/action plan as well as reviewing the strategy & business/action plan achievement.
* Socializing sales target to all Area Business Manager & Bancassurance Consultant.
* Evaluating & reviewing performance of Area Business Manager & Bancassurance Consultant. Periodically.
* Monitoring & controlling sales activity of all team sales to ensure that all sales team do as direct by company.
* Being a coach & consultant for all leaders (ABM & BC) regarding with sales improvement issue (such as marketing tools issue, sales event or project issue, etc)
* Monitoring key driver team to achieve target ANP and VONB.

Achieve Manpower performance target that includes:

* Ensure the recruitment process has done on place timely.
* Responsibility with Business Development (BDM)
* Ensure that the Manpower Quality meet with company expectation.
* Making a plan for Manpower continuous improvement for all team members including staff & leader level and make sure that the plan has done on place timely.
* Being a coach & consultant for all leaders (ABM & BC) regarding with manpower improvement issue (such as recruiting issue, development issue, competency improvement issue, etc).

Creating a synergy & good relationship with Bank Partner PIC especially with bank partner high level management.

Job Requirements:

* Min S1/S2 – Economics/Management or related major.
* Have a minimum 3 years' experience on managerial level in the insurance industries or related area (banking or finance).
* Able to work under pressure & tight deadline.
* Good Communication skills & managing expectation of the various Users and also responding to various inquiries.
* Proficient in computer operation (Microsoft-based office Applications), spreadsheet and presentation software.
* Articulate, communicates concisely and fluently in both English and Indonesian at all media.

*Build a career with us as we help our customers and the community live Healthier, Longer, Better Lives.*

*You must provide all requested information, including Personal Data, to be considered for this career opportunity. Failure to provide such information may influence the processing and outcome of your application. You are responsible for ensuring that the information you submit is accurate and up-to-date.*

title: External Communications Manager (English, Indonesian)
description:
### **Minimum qualifications:**

* Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
* 4 years of experience in public relations or media relations either in-house or agency.
* Ability to communicate in English and Indonesian fluently to support client relationship management in this region.

  

### **Preferred qualifications:**

* Experience with AI tools and ability to use AI to drive productivity, creativity, and innovation.
* Experience piloting new technologies or workflows and ability to navigate ambiguity and adapting to a fluid digital landscape.
* Understanding how to prompt and refine AI outputs to draft content frameworks, conduct landscape research, or summarize documents.
* Ability to build media relationships and shaping stories that drive conversations and understanding of the regional media environment.
* Ability to collaborate and build relationships with stakeholders across different departments and to work on multiple priorities, managing budgets, and building relationships with multiple key stakeholders.

**About the job**
-----------------

As a member of the Global Communications & Public Affairs team, you will work cross-functionally to help communicate with journalists and other thought leaders; devise specific communications materials and campaigns; engage in face-to-face meetings with commentators and other opinion formers; and develop print and web-based material supporting these campaigns. We're looking for great communicators who can understand complex issues and explain them in person and also via well written, simple blog posts, FAQs, video scripts and more.

We help inform and educate users, advertisers, partners, opinion leaders-and our own employees-about the benefits of Google's products, our distinctive company culture/values and our approach to the big public policy issues of the day. You are quick-witted, entrepreneurial and intellectually curious. To succeed in this role, you are willing to try new things and can manage numerous projects with tight deadlines. Things happen quickly at Google, and to do great work, you need to be an enthusiastic team player who can work cross-functionally with partners across PR, Communications, Marketing, Product, and beyond.

**Responsibilities**
--------------------

* Represent the business as a spokesperson. Gather, and draft responses to editorial inquiries, utilizing AI tools to collate background information and sentiment analysis to inform your approach.
* Create clear, concise, and differentiated communications plans and materials (emails, pitches, social copy). Use technology to improve the localization process.
* Track and analyze the impact of communication efforts. Move beyond basic metrics by utilizing AI-driven insights to analyze sentiment, predict trends, and refine communication strategies based on real-time data.
* Work with country teams to secure coverage for major initiatives. Act as a daily product expert, helping teams communicate user benefits and respond to issues and escalations with speed and accuracy.
* Integrate generative tools into your daily workflow to enhance creativity, improve operational efficiency (e.g., drafting, translating, formatting), and drive data-backed storytelling, while upholding Google’s AI Principles.

Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form.

title: Brand Executive (Contract-Based)
description:
**What we're looking for:**

A proactive and detail‑oriented Brand Executive to support the daily operational and administrative tasks for the full one of brand portfolio, ensuring smooth and timely operations.

  

**What You’ll Do:**

* Assist in executing Marketing and e-Commerce Marketing campaign tasks.
* Manage end-to-end Marketing & e‑Commerce Marketing POs (creation, tracking, vendor follow‑up, budget recording).
* Liaise with external vendors for samples and GWP handling, delivery, and closely monitor inventory level.
* Track and gain insights on key competitors by producing monthly competitors report.

title: Performance Marketing - E-commerce (Contract-based)
description:
* Develop and implement performance marketing strategies across paid search, social media advertising, display, affiliate marketing, and other digital channels.
* Manage and optimize campaigns on platforms such as in- and out-platforms to meet business objectives.
* Monitor and analyze campaign performance data to identify trends, insights, and opportunities for optimization.
* Conduct A/B testing and conversion rate optimization to improve campaign effectiveness and increase ROI.
* Collaborate with creative teams to develop ad creatives and messaging that resonate with target audiences.
* Manage budgets, bid strategies, and forecasts to ensure efficient allocation of marketing spend.
* Track and report on key performance indicators (KPIs), such as cost per acquisition (CPA), return on ad spend (ROAS), click-through rates (CTR), and conversion rates.

  

**The experience we're looking for:**

  

* A positive attitude and willingness to learn.
* Strong problem-solving and analytical skills.

title: T&T Senior Manager - Sales & Service (Go-To-Market) - ID
description:
T&T Senior Manager - Sales & Service (Go-To-Market) - ID

**Date:** 6 Feb 2026

**Service Line / Portfolios:** Customer

**Location:**Jakarta, ID

**Are you ready to unleash your potential?**

  

At Deloitte, our purpose is to make an impact that matters for our clients, our people, and the communities we serve.

  

We believe we have a responsibility to be a force for good, and WorldImpact is our portfolio of initiatives focused on making a tangible impact on society’s biggest challenges and creating a better future. We strive to advise clients on how to deliver purpose-led growth and embed more equitable, inclusive as well as sustainable business practices.

  

Hence, we seek talented individuals driven to excel and innovate, working together to achieve our shared goals.

We are committed to creating positive work experiences that foster a culture of respect and inclusion, where diverse perspectives are celebrated, and everyone is recognised for their contributions.

  

Ready to unleash your potential with us? Join the winning team now!

  

**Work you'll do:**

  

This role is with Deloitte Digital Southeast Asia. Across all clients and sectors, we believe great customer experiences create greater impact. That elevating the human experience creates enduring value, for the organization, for the customer, for society, for all.

  

As part of Sales & Service Transformation Team, you will leverage insight-driven strategies and advanced technology solutions to energize sales and service operations for digitally powered growth and enhance our client’s customer relationships with immersive experiences powered by leading digital arts. Eighty percent of the customer moments that make up their brand happen in the sales and service experience. We not only help our clients to make those memorable for their customers, but we integrate their whole business around those moments—whether it’s a trip into their supply chain, logistics, and fulfilment, or advancing the customer mind-set of their employees and partners.

You will:

* Work with the leadership in developing and building the Salesforce and Digital solutions practice
* Subject Matter Expert as it relates to digital and customer strategy, digital transformation, digital architecture, and large-scale customer platform implementations and delivery
* Serve as Digital and Salesforce sales leader to focus on sales to market leading clients with digital technology solutions for various Industries.
* Continue to evolve the local market segments across Southeast Asia, managing teams from a structure, talent, and competence perspective
* Grow the Salesforce offerings focused on core platform, industry solutions, marketing and commerce areas. Priority for industry solutions will be Telco and Utilities sectors
* Develop net new accounts with multi-year revenue potential in line with your managed NSR targets
* Drive profitable service delivery as per the firm engagement metrics
* Belief in client centricity with a commitment to deliver top class client service and relationships
* Take active leadership in talent identification, recruiting and retaining the practitioners aligned to Sales & Service Transformation offering
* Develop and sustain long-term, trust-based relationships with the clients, firm stakeholders and team

  

**Your role as a leader:**

  

At Deloitte, we believe in the importance of empowering our people to be leaders at all levels. We connect our purpose and shared values to identify issues as well as to make an impact that matters to our clients, people and the communities. Additionally, Directors across our Firm are expected to:

* Lead from the front, acting as an exemplary role model of integrity for leaders at all levels; promote a strong sense of loyalty and followership as well as to energise others to perform at the highest level
* Build a high-performance culture by cultivating individual and team strengths; drive outstanding service, quality and stakeholder value, often through a mix of large cross-business and/or cross-border teams.
* Anticipate market and competitor trends to develop and deliver bold and innovative solutions that differentiates Deloitte from others.
* Build and maintain trust-based relationships with senior stakeholders and influencers, using highly developed influencing skills to drive positive impact in complex situations.
* Set and communicate strategic direction, excite people around the vision and align diverse, cross-business as well as cross-border teams to achieve success.
* Manage the development of a strong pipeline of diverse talent for current/ future success; own and drive a talent experience that differentiates Deloitte from others.
* Actively manages the business to deliver maximum value to Deloitte and to external stakeholders.
* Anticipate market and competitor trends to develop and deliver bold and innovative solutions that differentiates Deloitte.

  

**Requirements:**

  

* Tertiary qualification in a relevant technology, business, or marketing discipline.
* Strong background in selling and delivering Salesforce based projects, across different industries.
* Ability to bring, build industry and partner network to build and drive business growth.
* Strong track record in building, managing / exceeding sales targets
* Experience in designing and implementing Salesforce platform in an enterprise or consulting environment.
* At least 15+ years overall development and architecture experience, preferably with specific industry verticals.
* Understanding of Salesforce platform, apps, and ability to conceptualize and build industry solutions.
* Strong consulting and/or Salesforce technology implementation experience.
* Strong relationship building and communications skills.
* Experience designing and implementing technology-enabled business solutions in client-facing and team leadership roles (e.g. Programme lead, business transformation lead, solution architect, project manager).
* Ability to fostering strong relationships and operating rhythms with leaders inside and outside client and product team to implement effective user experiences.
* Willing to push beyond the current capabilities and find the best solution for the business and our customers.
* Drive, tenacity, client focused and results oriented.
* Proven demonstration of sound business acumen, teamwork and leadership qualities.
* An appreciation of the consulting lifestyle and ability to travel (both locally and abroad

  

**Due to volume of applications, we regret only shortlisted candidates will be notified.**

  

**Please note that Deloitte will never reach out to you directly via messaging platforms to offer you employment opportunities or request for money or your personal information. Kindly apply for roles that you are interested in via this official Deloitte website.**

  

*#LI-AZ*

**Requisition ID:** 112459

In Indonesia, the services are provided by Imelda & Rekan and other related entities in Indonesia ("Deloitte in Indonesia"), which are affiliates of Deloitte Southeast Asia Ltd. Deloitte Southeast Asia Ltd is a member firm of Deloitte Touche Tohmatsu Limited. Deloitte in Indonesia, which is within the Deloitte Network, is the entity that is providing this Website.
company_description: We’re a leading professional services firm, but what makes working at Deloitte unique? When you join us, you become connected. To inspiring people. To meaningful work with fascinating clients.

title: Director of Rooms - Jakarta Marriott Hotel Gelora
description:
**Additional Information**  
**Job Number**26014604  
**Job Category**Rooms & Guest Services Operations  
**Location**Jakarta Marriott Hotel Gelora, One Marriott Drive, Jakarta Pusat, Indonesia, Indonesia  
**Schedule**Full Time  
**Located Remotely?**N  
**Position Type** Management  

**HOTEL DESCRIPTION**

Jakarta Marriott Hotel Gelora is a new standalone hotel with 235 keys. It is located in Central Jakarta on Palmerah Timur Road, a key route connecting South and Central Jakarta. Palmerah Station, a five-minute walk south of the site, is part of the Jakarta Green Commuter Line, which runs daily between Tanah Abang Station and Rangkasbitung Station in Banten. The hotel will be a 26-story building with 35 one- to three-bedroom apartments on the lower floors and 200 hotel rooms on the upper floors. It will also have three basement levels for parking. Facilities will include an all-day dining restaurant, two specialty restaurant (one Italian and one Japanese), three bars, a 490-square-meter ballroom, and five meeting rooms, totaling 986 square meters of function space.

**JOB SUMMARY**

Functions as the strategic business leader of the property's Rooms department. Responsible for planning, developing, implementing and evaluating the quality of property’s rooms. Position works with direct reports to develop and implement departmental strategies and ensures implementation of the brand service strategy and brand initiatives. The position ensures Rooms operations meet the brand’s standards, targets customer needs, ensures employee satisfaction, focuses on growing revenues and maximizes the financial performance of the department. Develops and implements property-wide strategies that deliver products and services to meet or exceed the needs and expectations of the brand’s target customer and employees and provides a return on investment to the owner and company.

**CANDIDATE PROFILE**

The ideal candidate should have prior experience working in Indonesia, preferably with hotel pre-opening experience and effectively able to communicate in local languages.

**Education and Experience**

* 2-year degree from an accredited university in Business Administration, Hotel and Restaurant Management, or related major; 4 years experience in the guest services, front desk, housekeeping, sales and marketing, management operations, or related professional area.

OR

* 4-year bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Hotel and Restaurant Management, or related major; 2 years experience in the guest services, front desk, housekeeping, sales and marketing, management operations, or related professional area.

**CORE WORK ACTIVITIES**

**Leading Rooms Team**

* Champions the brand’s service vision for product and service delivery.

* Communicates a clear and consistent message regarding departmental goals to produce desired results.

* Makes and executes the necessary decisions to keep property moving forward toward achievement of goals.

* Monitors and promotes room rates, specials, and promotions at the residence.

**Managing Profitability**

* Analyzes service issues and identifies trends.

* Works with Rooms team to develop an operational strategy that is aligned with the brand’s business strategy and leads its execution.

* Reviews and audits expenses.

**Managing Revenue Goals**

* Monitors Rooms operations sales performance against budget.

* Reviews reports and financial statements to determine Rooms operations performance against budget.

* Coaches and supports operations team to effectively manage occupancy and rate, wages and controllable expenses.

* Compares budgeted wages to actual wages, coaching direct reports to address problem areas and holding team accountable for results.

**Ensuring and Providing Exceptional Customer Service**

* Demonstrates and communicates key drivers of guest satisfaction for the brand’s target customer.

* Delivers excellent customer service throughout the customer experience and encourages the same from other employees.

* Reviews guest feedback with leadership team and ensures appropriate corrective action is taken.

* Coordinates and communicates event details both verbally and in writing to the customer and property operations.

* Creates an atmosphere in all Rooms areas that meets or exceeds guest expectations.

* Responds to and handles guest problems and complaints.

* Uses personal judgment and expertise to enhance the customer experience.

* Stays available to solve problems and/or suggest alternatives to previous arrangements.

* Interacts with guests to obtain feedback on product quality and service levels.

* Stays visible and interfaces with customers on a regular basis to obtain feedback on quality of product, service levels and overall satisfaction.

* Works to continually improve customer service by integrating obtained feedback and personal judgment into action plans.

* Emphasizes guest satisfaction during all departmental meetings and focuses on continuous improvement.

* Ensures that employees understand expectations and parameters for Room duties.

* Facilitates the development of creative solutions to overcome obstacles and ensures implementation to continually improve guest satisfaction results.

**Managing and Conducting Human Resources Activities**

* Interviews and hires employees.

* Ensures employees are treated fairly and equitably.

* Ensures that regular, ongoing communication is happening in Rooms (e.g., pre-shift briefings, staff meetings).

* Fosters employee commitment to providing excellent service, participates in daily stand-up meetings and models desired service behaviors in all interactions with guests and employees.

* Incorporates guest satisfaction as a component of staff/operations meetings with an emphasis on generating innovative ways to continually improve results.

* Sets goals and expectations for direct reports using the performance review process and holds staff accountable for successful performance.

* Solicits employee feedback, utilizes an “open door policy” and reviews employee satisfaction results to identify and address employee problems or concerns.

* Ensures property policies are administered fairly and consistently, disciplinary procedures and documentation are completed according to Standard and Local Operating Procedures (SOPs and LSOPs) and supports the Peer Review Process.

* Conducts annual performance appraisal with direct reports according to Standard Operating Procedures.

* Champions change, ensures brand and regional business initiatives are implemented and communicates follow-up actions to team as necessary.

* Identifies talents of direct reports and their teams, and assists with their growth and development plans.

*At Marriott International, we are dedicated to being an equal opportunity employer, welcoming all and providing access to opportunity. We actively foster an environment where the unique backgrounds of our associates are valued and celebrated. Our greatest strength lies in the rich blend of culture, talent, and experiences of our associates. We are committed to non-discrimination on any protected basis, including disability, veteran status, or other basis protected by applicable law.*

Marriott Hotels strive to elevate the art of hospitality, innovating at every opportunity while keeping the comfort of the oh-so-familiar all around the globe. As a host with Marriott Hotels, you will help keep the promise of “Wonderful Hospitality. Always.” by delivering thoughtful, heartfelt, forward-thinking service that upholds and builds upon this living legacy. With the name that’s synonymous with hospitality the world over, we are proud to welcome you to explore a career with Marriott Hotels. In joining Marriott Hotels, you join a portfolio of brands with Marriott International. **Be** where you can do your best work, **begin** your purpose, **belong** to an amazing global team, and **become** the best version of you.

JW Marriott is part of Marriott International's luxury portfolio and consists of more than 100 beautiful properties in gateway cities and distinctive resort locations around the world. JW believes our associates come first. Because if you’re happy, our guests will be happy. JW Marriott associates are confident, innovative, genuine, intuitive, and carry on the legacy of the brand’s namesake and company founder, J.Willard Marriott. Our hotels offer a work experience unlike any other, where you’ll be part of a community and enjoy true camaraderie with a diverse group of co-workers. JW creates opportunities for training, development, recognition and most importantly, a place where you can pursue your passions in a luxury environment with a focus on holistic well-being. Treating guests exceptionally starts with the way we take care of our associates. That’s The JW Treatment™. In joining JW Marriott, you join a portfolio of brands with Marriott International. **Be** where you can do your best work, **begin** your purpose, **belong** to an amazing global team, and **become** the best version of you.

title: Market Analyst
description:
* Conduct market and industry analysis within the **corporate rent** sector to support the company’s business strategy

* Present analytical findings and data in clear and effective presentations
* Coordinate with related teams in developing marketing strategies and solution offerings

#### **Job Qualifications**

* Minimum Bachelor’s degree in Management or Marketing, preferably from a business school or reputable university
* Minimum 1 year of relevant work experience
* Strong data analysis and data processing skills, particularly using Microsoft Excel
